meanings.definition: Of or relating to the focal point of an optical system.
meanings.sent1: The epifocal lens helped improve the clarity of the image.
meanings.sent2: The epifocal mirror reflected light precisely at the focal point.
meanings.sent3: The epifocal glasses made everything look super clear, even the tiniest details!
meanings.sent4: Her epifocal vision allowed her to see things others couldn't.
meanings.sent5: The epifocal adjustment made the picture sharp and focused.

meanings.definition: Located at or near the focal point of an optical system.
meanings.sent1: The epifocal position of the lens ensured accurate focusing.
meanings.sent2: The epifocal distance between the lens and the sensor was crucial for sharp images.
meanings.sent3: He placed the epifocal mirror in just the right spot for maximum reflection.
meanings.sent4: The epifocal alignment of the telescope made stargazing a breathtaking experience.
meanings.sent5: The epifocal location of the light source enhanced the visibility of the object.
